cinnamon.engine.system

Class Game<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.system.Game<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleGame

    public abstract class Game<T>
extends Object

    This class is responsible for not only controlling the game's tick rate but also providing properties and services to different parts of the game. Subclasses may, for example, retrieve systems such as getControlMap() to change keyboard or mouse control bindings.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Game.Resources<E extends GameObjectManager.GObject>
      The Resources class provides access to various factories which produce not only ComponentManager.Components for assembling GameObjectManager.GObjects but also other sources for building game materials such as the GObjectFactory itself.
      static class  Game.Services
      Services gives access to parts of the engine that control specific aspects such as user control bindings or handling and publishing Events.

      static String DEBUG_MODE
      Toggle for enabling debug actions through console input.

      Constant value for enabling a property whose expected value is a toggle.

      Number of seconds before an average per second tickrate is measured.

      Target tickrate for updates per second.

      • Game

        public Game(Canvas canvas,
            Game.Services services,

        Constructor for a Game.

        Parameters:
        canvas - drawing surface.
        services - Services for running various game systems.
        properties - game properties such as TITLE and VSYNC.

      • getTickRate

        public final int getTickRate()

        Gets the set tick rate.

        Returns:
        ticks per second.

      • getTickSize

        public final long getTickSize()

        Gets the desired duration of a game tick in nanoseconds.

        This method is dependent on the tickrate submitted as a property in Game(Canvas, Services, Map) using the name TICKRATE.

        Returns:
        desired nanosecond duration.

      • getTitle

        public final String getTitle()

        Gets the game's title.

        Returns:
        title.

      • getVersion

        public final String getVersion()

        Gets the game's build version.

        Returns:
        version.

      • start

        public final void start()

        Calls on the Game to begin.

      • stop

        public final void stop()

        Signals the game to prepare shutting down.

        This method does not interrupt a game tick from completing but will prevent subsequent ticks from beginning . onEnd() is called after the current tick has completed.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
